original: Colliander, Sven Caril Fredrik Ernst, direktör, Göteborg, f. 28/8/07 i Gbg av rådman E. C. o. Conny Berggren. G. 32 m. Lisa Gullander. Barn: Bo Ernst f. 33, Björn Einar Ernst 37. — Stud:-ex. i Gbg 28, stud, v. Holmqvists hand:inst., Gbgs högsk., Sthlms liögsk, o. Gbgs hand:högsk. 29-30. Res. t. Norge, Danm., Finl. o. flert. övr. europ. länd. Ind :prakt. i uti. olika period., fabr :chef v. A-B Gbgs Kexfabr. i Kungälv 30, dir:assist. 35, dir. sed. 39. Led. av styr. f. A-B Gbgs Kexfabr. sed. 29, v. ordf. där sed. 43, led. av styr. f. A-B Sv:es Fören. Konservfabr, sed. 35 samt av styr. f. div. fastigh :bol., rev :uppdr., led. av styr. f. Gbgs sjöv:flott. o. flott :intend. Fänr. i sjöv:kåT. 40, löjtn. 45. Medl. av Odd Fellow o. Göta Coldinuorden. Hobby: naturvet :skap (mikrobioL). SVKSM 45.
translated: Colliander, Sven Caril Fredrik Ernst, director, Gothenburg, born August 28, 1907 in Gothenburg to councilor E.C. and Conny Berggren. Married in 1932 to Lisa Gullander. Children: Bo Ernst, born in 1933, Björn Einar Ernst, born in 1937. Studied in Gothenburg and at Holmqvists handelsinstitut, Gothenburg University, Stockholm University and Gothenburg Handelsinstitut from 1928 to 1930. Traveled to Norway, Denmark, Finland and several other European countries for practical work experience. Became the factory manager of AB Gothenburg Biscuit Factory in Kungälv in 1930, director's assistant in 1935 and director in 1939. Became a board member of AB Gothenburg Biscuit Factory in 1929, vice chairman since 1943 and also a member of the board of AB Sweden's Canning Factory since 1935, as well as a member of various real estate companies' boards and ship squadron and navy intendence. Was a second lieutenant in the navy in 1945 and a member of Odd Fellow and Gotha Coldinuorden. Hobbies include natural science (microbiology). Received the Royal Patriotic Society's gold medal in 1945.
